snippet: As agriculture committee leaders in Congress push to have their farm bills rolled into any deficit deal, a watchdog group questions past savings projections.
abstract: As agriculture committee leaders in Congress push to have their farm bills rolled into any deficit deal, a watchdog group questions past savings projections.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For weeks, leaders of the House and Senate Agriculture Committees have been pushing for their stalled farm bills, which cut spending, to be rolled into any deficit deal between President Obama and Congressional Republicans.

headline.main: Farm Bill Savings? Not Again, Watchdog Says
